thread.title: Your password might be easy to guess for hackers
thread.title_full: Your password might be easy to guess for hackers

author: INDIATODAY
title: Your password might be easy to guess for hackers
text:
By Divya Bhati
NordPass's latest research reveals that the most common password globally and in India is "123456".
According to the report, over 76,000 users in India and 3 million globally use "123456," with "123456789" being the second most popular password worldwide.
Many of the top passwords in both India and the world are simple combinations like "qwerty" and "123456789," making them easy to crack.
Simple variations such as "qwerty123" are the most common passwords in countries like the Netherlands, Finland, and Canada, and also feature in India’s top 10.
Meanwhile, the word "password" continues to be a popular choice, ranking second in India and top in countries like Australia and the UK.
Indian users also personalise their passwords, with variations like "Indya123" instead of "India123."
The report warns that around 78% of the world’s most common passwords can be cracked in under a second, showing a concerning increase from last year’s 70%.
Additionally, corporate passwords are just as weak, with 40% of commonly used passwords by individuals and businesses being the same.
Default passwords such as "admin," "newmember," and "welcome" are frequently used for business accounts, leading to security breaches.
